adrFormatAddress: 266 E 10th St, New York, NY 10009, USA

editorialSummary.text: Calm, spacious facility offering classes in the Gyrotonic fitness system, as well as Pilates.

originalText.text:
Favorite pilates studio ive been to in the city!
super lovely staff and cozy environment. No judgement zone and they really work on being able to work with everyone's pace.
Would highly recommend:)

text.text:
Favorite pilates studio ive been to in the city!
super lovely staff and cozy environment. No judgement zone and they really work on being able to work with everyone's pace.
Would highly recommend:)

originalText.text: Best GYROTONIC and Pilates studio in NYC! All teachers are amazing, with lots of knowledge, humanity and beautiful smiles. I recommend to everybody! Go and try!

text.text: Best GYROTONIC and Pilates studio in NYC! All teachers are amazing, with lots of knowledge, humanity and beautiful smiles. I recommend to everybody! Go and try!

originalText.text: Great studio fully equipped with pilates and Gyroyonics. I have been coming to this studio for years- good teachers and great atmosphere.

text.text: Great studio fully equipped with pilates and Gyroyonics. I have been coming to this studio for years- good teachers and great atmosphere.

originalText.text:
Pilates itself was a nice experience, the instructor
however... not so nice! Instructor Natasha wasn't welcoming AT ALL! Given that when she asked who were beginners and others raised their hands… she sighed & rolled her eyes as if everyone should've already known what they were doing. During class she kept giving the impression that your mistakes are so bad, a lot of eye rolling and kept trying to fix you, but was so rude about it. I DO NOT recommend her, literally go to anyone but her! Aside from the excessive eye rolling & heavy sighing... she was very.. monotone (I understand some people are like that) but, there's no warmth there, and as a beginner you'd be hoping for someone inviting/motivating... definitely not what I wanted for my first pilates experience. I’d definitely do Pilates again, just not with her!

originalText.text: My only complaint for this whole experience was the instructor, Natasha. Right at the beginning of the class she asked if it was anyone’s first time trying a Pilates class and when majority of us raised our hands, she rolled her eyes. This was my very first Pilates class and she ruined my experience due to her lack of tone control and passive aggressiveness. She would repeatedly get annoyed at us for not getting moves right on the first try and pick on us. On multiple occasions she asked a few of us if we have no fitness experience because we seemed to be struggling. As an instructor, you should be professional enough to have patience when teaching a class despite the students’ experience. It’s not a good feeling to take time out of your day to want to try something something new then leave the establishment feeling worse than when you entered. Other than that, the place was nice and clean. I would recommend anyone traveling here to book under a different instructor.
